00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the base Binary Operator class
00004 #
00005 
00006 package Parser::BOP;
00007 use strict; no strict "refs";
00008 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00009 
00010 $Parser::class->{BOP} = 'Parser::BOP';
00011 
00012 #
00013 #  Make a new instance of a BOP
00014 #
00015 #  Make left and right operands into lists if they are comma operators
00016 #    and this operator isn't itself a comma.
00017 #
00018 sub new {
00019   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00020   my $equation = shift; my $context = $equation->{context};
00021   my ($bop,$lop,$rop,$ref) = @_;
00022   my $def = $context->{operators}{$bop};
00023   if (!$def->{isComma}) {
00024     $lop = $self->Item("List",$context)->new($equation,[$lop->makeList],
00025        $lop->{isConstant},$context->{parens}{start}) if ($lop->type eq 'Comma');
00026     $rop = $self->Item("List",$context)->new($equation,[$rop->makeList],$rop->{isConstant},
00027        $context->{parens}{start}) if ($rop->type eq 'Comma');
00028   }
00029   my $BOP = bless {
00030     bop => $bop, lop => $lop, rop => $rop,
00031     def => $def, ref => $ref, equation => $equation,
00032   }, $def->{class};
00033   $BOP->weaken;
00034   $BOP->{isConstant} = 1 if ($lop->{isConstant} && $rop->{isConstant});
00035   $BOP->_check;
00036   $BOP = $BOP->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$BOP->eval])
00037     if $BOP->{isConstant} && !$def->{isComma} && $context->flag('reduceConstants');
00038   return $BOP;
00039 }

00041 #
00042 #  Stub for checking if the BOP can operate on the given operands.
00043 #  (Implemented in subclasses.)
00044 #
00045 sub _check {}

00049 #
00050 #  Evaluate the left and right operands and peform the
00051 #  required operation on the results.
00052 #
00053 sub eval {
00054   my $self = shift;
00055   $self->_eval($self->{lop}->eval,$self->{rop}->eval);
00056 }
00057 #
00058 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00059 #
00060 sub _eval {return $_[1]}
00061 
00062 #
00063 #  Reduce the left and right operands.
00064 #  If they are constant (and it's not a comma), make a constant value of them.
00065 #  Otherwise, reduce the result.
00066 #
00067 sub reduce {
00068   my $self = shift; my $bop = $self->{def};
00069   $self->{lop} = $self->{lop}->reduce;
00070   $self->{rop} = $self->{rop}->reduce;
00071   return $self->Item("Value")->new($self->{equation},[$self->eval])
00072     if (!$bop->{isComma} && $self->{lop}{isConstant} && $self->{rop}{isConstant});
00073   $self->_reduce;
00074 }
00075 #
00076 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00077 #
00078 sub _reduce {shift}
00079 
00080 #
00081 #  Substitute in the left and right operands.
00082 #
00083 sub substitute {
00084   my $self = shift; my $bop = $self->{def};
00085   $self->{lop} = $self->{lop}->substitute;
00086   $self->{rop} = $self->{rop}->substitute;
00087   my $equation = $self->{equation}; my $context = $equation->{context};
00088   return $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$self->eval])
00089     if !$bop->{isComma} && $self->{lop}{isConstant} && $self->{rop}{isConstant} &&
00090         $context->flag('reduceConstants');
00091   return $self;
00092 }
00093 
00094 #
00095 #  Copy the left and right operands as well as the rest
00096 #    of the equations.
00097 #
00098 sub copy {
00099   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00100   my $new = $self->SUPER::copy($equation);
00101   $new->{lop} = $self->{lop}->copy($equation);
00102   $new->{rop} = $self->{rop}->copy($equation);
00103   return $new;
00104 }

00108 #  Service routines for checking the types of operands.

00111 
00112 #
00113 #  Error if one of the operands is a string.
00114 #
00115 sub checkStrings {
00116   my $self = shift; return 0 if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00117   my $ltype = $self->{lop}->typeRef; my $rtype = $self->{rop}->typeRef;
00118   my $name = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{bop};
00119   if ($ltype->{name} eq 'String') {
00120     $self->Error("Operands of '%s' can't be %s",$name,
00121          ($self->{lop}{isInfinite}? 'infinities': 'words'));
00122     return 1;
00123   }
00124   if ($rtype->{name} eq 'String') {
00125     $self->Error("Operands of '%s' can't be %s",$name,
00126          ($self->{rop}{isInfinite}? 'infinities': 'words'));
00127     return 1;
00128   }
00129   return 0;
00130 }
00131 
00132 #
00133 #  Error if one of the operands is a list.
00134 #
00135 sub checkLists {
00136   my $self = shift; return 0 if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00137   my $ltype = $self->{lop}->typeRef; my $rtype = $self->{rop}->typeRef;
00138   return 0 if ($ltype->{name} ne 'List' and $rtype->{name} ne 'List');
00139   my $name = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{bop};
00140   $self->Error("Operands of '%s' can't be lists",$name);
00141   return 1;
00142 }
00143 
00144 #
00145 #  Determine if both operands are numbers, and promote to
00146 #    complex numbers if one is complex.
00147 #
00148 sub checkNumbers {
00149   my $self = shift;
00150   return 0 if !($self->{lop}->isNumber && $self->{rop}->isNumber) &&
00151               !$self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00152   if ($self->{lop}->isComplex || $self->{rop}->isComplex) {
00153     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{complex};
00154   } else {
00155     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{number};
00156   }
00157   return 1;
00158 }
00159 
00160 #
00161 #  Check if two matrices can be multiplied.
00162 #
00163 sub checkMatrixSize {
00164   my $self = shift;
00165   my ($lm,$rm) = @_;
00166   my ($ltype,$rtype) = ($lm->{entryType},$rm->{entryType});
00167   if ($ltype->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number' &&
00168       $rtype->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number') {
00169     my ($lr,$lc) = ($lm->{length},$ltype->{length});
00170     my ($rr,$rc) = ($rm->{length},$rtype->{length});
00171     if ($lc == $rr) {
00172       my $rowType = Value::Type('Matrix',$rc,$Value::Type{number},formMatrix=>1);
00173       $self->{type} = Value::Type('Matrix',$lr,$rowType,formMatrix=>1);
00174     } else {$self->Error("Matrices of dimensions %dx%d and %dx%d can't be multiplied",$lr,$lc,$rr,$rc)}
00175   } else {$self->Error("Matrices are too deep to be multiplied")}
00176 }
00177 
00178 #
00179 #  Promote point operands to vectors or matrices.
00180 #
00181 sub promotePoints {
00182   my $self = shift; my $class = shift;
00183   my $ltype = $self->{lop}->typeRef;
00184   my $rtype = $self->{rop}->typeRef;
00185   if ($ltype->{name} eq 'Point' ||
00186       ($ltype->{name} eq 'Matrix' && !$ltype->{entryType}{entryType})) {
00187     $ltype = {%{$ltype}, name => 'Vector'};
00188     $ltype = Value::Type($class,1,Value::Type($class,1,$ltype->{entryType}))
00189       if ($ltype->{length} == 1 && $class);
00190   }
00191   if ($rtype->{name} eq 'Point' ||
00192       ($rtype->{name} eq 'Matrix' && !$rtype->{entryType}{entryType})) {
00193     $rtype = {%{$rtype}, name => 'Vector'};
00194     $rtype = Value::Type($class,1,Value::Type($class,1,$rtype->{entryType}))
00195       if ($rtype->{length} == 1 && $class);
00196   }
00197   return ($ltype,$rtype);
00198 }
00199 
00200 #
00201 #  Report an error if the operand types don't match.
00202 #
00203 sub matchError {
00204   my $self = shift; return if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00205   my ($ltype,$rtype) = @_;
00206   my ($op,$ref) = ($self->{bop});
00207   if ($ltype->{name} eq $rtype->{name})
00208        {$self->Error("Operands for '%s' must be of the same length",$op)}
00209   else {$self->Error("Operands for '%s' must be of the same type",$op)}
00210 }

00217 #
00218 #  Return a zero, or a list of zeros of the proper length.
00219 #
00220 sub makeZero {
00221   my $self = shift; my $op = shift; my $zero = shift;
00222   return $zero if ($op->isNumber);
00223   if ($zero->isNumber && $op->type =~ m/Point|Vector/) {
00224     $op->{coords} = []; $op->{isZero} = 1;
00225     foreach my $i (0..($op->length-1)) {push(@{$op->{coords}},$zero)}
00226     return $op
00227   }
00228   return $self;
00229 }

00231 #
00232 #  Produce a negated version of a BOP.
00233 #
00234 sub makeNeg {
00235   my $self = shift;
00236   $self->{lop} = shift; $self->{rop} = shift;
00237   return Parser::UOP::Neg($self);
00238 }
00239 
00240 #
00241 #  Reverse the operands (left <=> right).
00242 #
00243 sub swapOps {
00244   my $self = shift;
00245   my $tmp = $self->{lop}; $self->{lop} = $self->{rop}; $self->{rop} = $tmp;
00246   return $self;
00247 }
00248 
00249 #
00250 #  Get the variables from the two operands
00251 #
00252 sub getVariables {
00253   my $self = shift;
00254   return {%{$self->{lop}->getVariables},%{$self->{rop}->getVariables}};
00255 }
00256 
00257 ##################################################
00258 #
00259 #  Generate the various output formats.
00260 #
00261 
00262 
00263 #
00264 #  Produce a string version of the BOP.
00265 #
00266 #  Parentheses are added when either:
00267 #    we are told to from our parent
00268 #    the BOP says to (fullparens)
00269 #    the BOP's precedence is lower than it's parent's, or
00270 #    the precedences are equal and either
00271 #       the associativity is right
00272 #       or we are supposed to show parens for the same precedence
00273 #
00274 sub string {
00275   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight) = @_;
00276   my $string; my $bop = $self->{def};
00277   $position = '' unless defined($position);
00278   $showparens = '' unless defined($showparens);
00279   my $extraParens = $self->context->flag('showExtraParens');
00280   my $addparens =
00281       defined($precedence) &&
00282       ($showparens eq 'all' || (($showparens eq 'extra' || $bop->{fullparens}) && $extraParens > 1) ||
00283        $precedence > $bop->{precedence} || ($precedence == $bop->{precedence} &&
00284         ($bop->{associativity} eq 'right' || ($showparens eq 'same' && $extraParens))));
00285   $outerRight = !$addparens && ($outerRight || $position eq 'right');
00286 
00287   $string = $self->{lop}->string($bop->{precedence},$bop->{leftparens},'left',$outerRight).
00288             $bop->{string}.
00289             $self->{rop}->string($bop->{precedence},$bop->{rightparens},'right');
00290 
00291   $string = $self->addParens($string) if $addparens;
00292   return $string;
00293 }
00294 
00295 #
00296 #  Produce the TeX version of the BOP.
00297 #
00298 sub TeX {
00299   my ($self,$precedence,$showparens,$position,$outerRight) = @_;
00300   my $TeX; my $bop = $self->{def};
00301   $position = '' unless defined($position);
00302   $showparens = '' unless defined($showparens);
00303   my $extraParens = $self->context->flag('showExtraParens');
00304   my $addparens =
00305       defined($precedence) &&
00306       (($showparens eq 'all' && $extraParens > 1) || $precedence > $bop->{precedence} ||
00307       ($precedence == $bop->{precedence} &&
00308         ($bop->{associativity} eq 'right' || ($showparens eq 'same' && $extraParens))));
00309   $outerRight = !$addparens && ($outerRight || $position eq 'right');
00310 
00311   $TeX = $self->{lop}->TeX($bop->{precedence},$bop->{leftparens},'left',$outerRight).
00312          (defined($bop->{TeX}) ? $bop->{TeX} : $bop->{string}) .
00313          $self->{rop}->TeX($bop->{precedence},$bop->{rightparens},'right');
00314 
00315   $TeX = '\left('.$TeX.'\right)' if $addparens;
00316   return $TeX;
00317 }
00318 
00319 #
00320 #  Produce the perl version of the BOP.
00321 #
00322 sub perl {
00323   my $self= shift; my $parens = shift;
00324   my $bop = $self->{def}; my $perl;
00325   if ($bop->{isCommand}) {
00326     $perl =
00327       ($bop->{perl} || ref($self).'->call').
00328         '('.$self->{lop}->perl.','.$self->{rop}->perl.')';
00329   } else {
00330     $perl =
00331         $self->{lop}->perl(1).
00332     " ".($bop->{perl} || $bop->{string})." ".
00333         $self->{rop}->perl(2);
00334   }
00335   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00336   return $perl;
00337 }
